DataElement.preferredName: Measured Less Than or Equal 1.5 Times Upper Limit of Normal International Normalized Ratio Or Prothrombin Time Within Anticoagulant Agent Therapeutic Range Occurrence Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether the result of the International Normalized Ratio (INR) or Prothrombin Time (PT) is less than or equal to 1.5 times the institution upper limit of normal (ULN), unless the use of anticoagulant therapy requires a therapeutic range that must be observed.

Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.On the inside; contained in._Agents that prevent blood clotting. Concepts.definition: Having been determined by measurement.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

A system, commonly called the INR, established by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for reporting the results of blood coagulation (clotting) tests. All results are standardized using the international sensitivity index (ISI) for the particular thromboplastin reagent and instrument combination utilized to perform the test; the ratio of a patient's clotting time to the lab's mean reference value is normalized against the ISI. (from medterms.com and medicine.ucsf.edu)

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.

Property.preferredName: Within Anticoagulant Agent Therapeutic Range Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs.:Relating to or involved in therapy.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: On the inside; contained in.
Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation.
Relating to or involved in therapy.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study International No
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study International Normalized Ratio (INR) or Prothrombin Time (PT) less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN unless subject is receiving anticoagulant therapy not requiring laboratory monitoring as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants?
